about.name: Reykjavik
about.info_text: Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland, is a unique and vibrant city that combines rich culture, stunning natural beauty, and a deep connection to the country's Viking heritage. The city is known for its colorful buildings, vibrant arts scene, and proximity to incredible landscapes, including geysers, waterfalls, and the Northern Lights. Reykjavik offers a one-of-a-kind blend of urban sophistication and rugged wilderness, making it a must-visit destination for adventurers and culture enthusiasts alike.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 130,000
Region: Capital Region
Time Zone: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT+0)
Language: Icelandic, English
Currency: Icelandic Krona (ISK)
about.climate_text: Reykjavik experiences a subarctic climate, with cool summers and cold winters. It's known for its ever-changing weather, which can include sunny days, rain, and snow all in one day. The city's coastal location makes it milder than other places at similar latitudes.

attractions_card.title: Hallgrímskirkja
attractions_card.description: Hallgrímskirkja is a striking Lutheran church and one of Reykjavik's most iconic landmarks, known for its unique modern design and panoramic views from the tower.

attractions_card.title: The Sun Voyager
attractions_card.description: The Sun Voyager is a famous sculpture located along Reykjavik's waterfront, representing a dreamboat and symbolizing the promise of undiscovered territory.

attractions_card.title: Harpa Concert Hall
attractions_card.description: Harpa is a remarkable concert hall and conference center with a distinct glass façade, hosting various events, including musical performances and exhibitions.

attractions_card.title: Blue Lagoon
attractions_card.description: The Blue Lagoon is a geothermal spa located in a lava field, offering warm mineral-rich waters with healing properties, making it a popular relaxation spot.

attractions_card.title: Golden Circle
attractions_card.description: The Golden Circle is a famous route that includes three major attractions: Thingvellir National Park, Geysir geothermal area, and Gullfoss waterfall.

attractions_card.title: National Museum of Iceland
attractions_card.description: The National Museum showcases Iceland's history, culture, and heritage through a wide range of artifacts and exhibitions.

attractions_card.title: Perlan
attractions_card.description: Perlan is a unique dome-shaped structure that houses a rotating restaurant, exhibition space, and a viewing platform offering panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Whale Watching
attractions_card.description: Reykjavik is a hub for whale watching tours, where you can spot various marine wildlife, including whales, dolphins, and seabirds.

food_card.title: Icelandic Lamb
food_card.description: Icelandic lamb is renowned for its tender and flavorful meat, often served as lamb chops or in traditional dishes like lamb stew.

food_card.title: Pylsa (Hot Dog)
food_card.description: Icelandic hot dogs, or pylsur, are a beloved snack made with a blend of meats, including lamb, and are typically topped with crispy onions, remoulade sauce, and more.

food_card.title: Skyr
food_card.description: Skyr is a creamy and healthy dairy product that resembles yogurt, often served with berries and honey or used in desserts.

food_card.title: Icelandic Fish
food_card.description: Fresh fish is a staple in Icelandic cuisine, with options like cod, haddock, and Arctic char, often prepared in various delicious ways.

food_card.title: Rúgbrauð (Rye Bread)
food_card.description: Rúgbrauð is a dense and sweet Icelandic rye bread, traditionally baked in the ground with geothermal heat.

hotels_card.title: Icelandair Hotel Reykjavik Natura
hotels_card.description: Icelandair Hotel Reykjavik Natura is a comfortable and eco-friendly hotel, conveniently located near the city center and nature areas.

hotels_card.title: Radisson Blu Saga Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Radisson Blu Saga Hotel offers a blend of modern comfort and a historic setting, featuring comfortable rooms and excellent dining options.

hotels_card.alt: Canopy by Hilton Reykjavik City Centre
hotels_card.title: Canopy by Hilton Reykjavik City Centre
hotels_card.description: Canopy by Hilton provides a stylish and central stay with a local touch, making it an ideal base for exploring the city.

hotels_card.title: Fosshotel Reykjavik
hotels_card.description: Fosshotel Reykjavik is a modern and centrally located hotel, featuring comfortable rooms and panoramic views from the tower.

hotels_card.title: Icelandair Hotel Reykjavik Marina
hotels_card.description: Icelandair Hotel Reykjavik Marina is a quirky and artistic hotel located in the old harbor area, offering unique and cozy accommodations.

transport_card.title: Keflavik International Airport
transport_card.description: Keflavik International Airport (KEF) is the main international airport in Iceland, serving Reykjavik and connecting the country to the world.

transport_card.title: Reykjavik Domestic Airport
transport_card.description: Reykjavik Domestic Airport (RKV) offers domestic flights within Iceland and serves as a convenient hub for exploring the country.

transport_card.title: Public Bus System
transport_card.description: Reykjavik has a public bus system that covers the city and nearby areas, providing an affordable way to get around.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rentals are a popular choice for exploring Iceland's stunning landscapes, with several rental companies available at the airport.
